title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Quick process. Down to earth questions. Very personable. The interviewer was nice and humourous which helped to calm my nerves. It went by super quick. They asked the most common questions, nothing out of the ordinary.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work here?

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was Straightforward. One interview with an HR recruiter and additional interviews with the department office manager and practice administrator for non clinical positions. Non clinical positions don’t get a peer interview process.
Interview Questions: Describe a time where you faced a difficult patient interaction.

title: Advanced Practice Provider Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I had Several interviews but it seemed Difficult to get answers. Salary seemed very low for the work. Didn’t get to follow up as the pandemic started and everything shut down.
Interview Questions: Who referred you to LMC

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Jan 2023
Interview Descriptions: Talked to HR to understand the process. Then the nurse manager to be asked question. I was told I needed to get 5 references in 48 hours. 2 superiors 3 colleagues.
Interview Questions: How do you share tasks with others?

title: Cardiac Monitor Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of an initial digital one way interview that asked pretty generic interview questions such as “tell me about a time when you faced a stressful situation at work and how you handled it”. The in person interview was very comfortable and involved questions about my training and career goals
Interview Questions: Where do you see this career taking you?

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: The interview was with multiple people in the room such as the manager, supervisors, and LMC work coordinators. The training is great and it is organized and your given 3 months to train and then your on your own shift that you applied for.
Interview Questions: What makes you more unique than the others & What can you contribute to the department (skills and traits about yourself)

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very laid back, one on one. The interviewer was personable and asked basic interview questions, I felt comfortable talking to her, it made me feel less nervous. Heard back within 2 weeks of interview
Interview Questions: How do you handle difficult situations

title: Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was completely virtual and I had to record videos of myself speaking. HR was quick to send me an offer to interview but very slow to ever respond. I set up interviews at two other places before I ever heard back about the position.
Interview Questions: Talk about a time when you went above and beyond to assist a patient.

title: Sterile Processing Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Mar 2022
Interview Descriptions: Very easy to navigate! Done via computer. I felt very comfortable doing it like this and less nervous. I did get a call for in person interview for that department.
Interview Questions: What qualifications I can bring to the department

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Easy and smooth process. Applied and got a response a few days later. Had to do a one way video interview. Very straight forward and to the point. Offered job not long afterwards.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Temporary Worker Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview was online and super straightforward (only behavioral questions). There were only about 4 questions, and it gives you a prompt, and you can record your answer. It also gives you the option to rerecord your answer.
Interview Questions: Why are you interested in this position？

title: Medical Social Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The first part of the interview was virtual. It had an odd timeout that I am not sure if the company holds the interviewee to. You are able to record your answers. I recommend saving the videos to your phone just in case the videos don’t properly upload.
Interview Questions: What is a difficult situation you faced and how did you handle it?

title: Administrative Fellowship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: there was a lack of communication and a lot of waiting. Interviewers were kind but they do ghost their candidates which is frowned upon by candidates who spent hours preparing the lengthy application requirements.
Interview Questions: What is your greatest achievement thus far?

title: Customer Service Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Sept 2021
Interview Descriptions: Virtual interview followed by face to face . Hiring process was fairly quick. Your face to face interview will be with a recruiter and supervosor . Just relax and don’t think too much .
Interview Questions: Tell me about a time you had to go above and beyond to service a dissatisfied customer. What steps did you take to handle the call. What was the outcome .

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Straight forward. Received call for interview, went to interview and saw HR rep, then a couple of days later per with department head. Was given open positions to choose from, but nonetheless the availability worked for my current situation. Everyone was very friendly. The process was pleasant and it seemed like a wonderful place to work.
Interview Questions: What are your career goals

title: Birth Doula Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Sept 2020
Interview Descriptions: I was scheduled to come in for a live interview. I arrived and someone met me at the front desk. I interviewed and they contacted me within the week to complete reference emails. It was very easy and enjoyable!
Interview Questions: Why did I choose to become a doula?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Friendly  and welcoming process, the interviewer was extremely kind. The interview occurred over the phone due to the coronavirus pandemic. I heard back the same day in regards to background check and references.
Interview Questions: What would you say is your best strength?

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Irmo, SC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Great office manager. Not hard at all. Discussed the job and talked as if we have known each other for a very long time. Didn’t take that long.  Love the fact that it’s a family oriented company
Interview Questions: Why do you want to root here ?

title: Medical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Aug 2020
Interview Descriptions: Interview process was explained and very easy going. They let you know within a few days after your interview. Super nice group of people. I’m normally super nervous during interviews but they don’t make it so terrifying.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have in the job you’ve applied for?

title: Registered Respiratory Therapist (RRT) Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Jun 2020
Interview Descriptions: Everything was very casual and flowed easily. I interviewed in the peak of covid and from out of state so it was via video call. It was a smooth process and not too stressful.
Interview Questions: The normal “tell me about yourself”.

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: Either an online interview through a partners website or in person with usually the office manager and practice administrator.  Asked questions regarding to the position applied for. Pretty laid back for the most part.
Interview Questions: Previous jobs held in healthcare?

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with recruiter which took about 10 minutes and she asked me a few questions/went over benefits/pay/orientation. Then with the unit manager; asked questions and showed me around the floor.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? What experience do you have working as a nurse tech?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Jan 2020
Interview Descriptions: One on one interview. The process was very smooth. Meeting with HR, where they tell your job description and salary. From there you will set in touch with your hiving manager in the department.
Interview Questions: What makes you want to work in this department? Are you open to picking up extra shifts if needed?

title: CMA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Oct 2019
Interview Descriptions: Went to HR for interview. Then was sent to a few different places. Still waiting to hear back from them. Once I did my first interview I then was schedule to go back a week later to have a peer interview. Still waiting to hear back from that one. They walk you around and talk to you about what they do and the spot you will be filling.
Interview Questions: what is your weekness?

title: Xray Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: HR calles and scheduled an in person interview. Was told to go to main lobby and check in at front desk. Did so and front desk attendant was very rude. Not a good first impression. The interview itself went okay. Basic questions asked, not too cliche though. Havent heard back but if I do I wouldn't take the job
Interview Questions: What are some of your strengths

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was very comfortable and straightforward. You meet with a HR representative before they decide if you will be a good fit for any of the individual branches.
Interview Questions: What is your current education level?

title: Radiologic Technologist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Aug 2019
Interview Descriptions: I was interviewed by the hiring manager and then the department supervisors. It was a pleasant experience. They were very kind and helpful throughout the process. They answered all questions I had, and didn’t make me answer the same question over and over in different words.
Interview Questions: What was one time you had to deal with a situation outside your comfort zone?

title: Revenue Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: interview with HR then with practice then with some staff it was not a hard interview asked the same questions it was easy. took awhile for them to call for an offer but got the job
Interview Questions: Why did you want to work with Lexington

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was fairly easy and quick. I met with the inpatient nurse recruiter who then helped me find openings and scheduled two in-person interviews with unit nurse managers.
Interview Questions: I was asked about my patient care experiences.

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Apr 2019
Interview Descriptions: Brief to the point. Great experience the interview was short and sweet. The interviewer was kind and felt very present throughout. I thought the questions were relevant and easy to answer. The interview was virtual and lasted 1 round. Following the interview I consented to a background check and provided at least 5 references.
Interview Questions: What skills can you bring to LMC

title: Resident Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: They were extremely nice and understanding! Joana is easygoing and very kind. They listen to you and explain the job thoroughly. They follow up with you right away and let you know what the next process is.
Interview Questions: Why are you fit for this job?

title: Clinical Applications Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Jan 2019
Interview Descriptions: It was great to the point with specific questions to my line of work. Initially did an hr interview with the boilerplate questions and review of the perks e.g. pto retirement. Then had an interview with my department
Interview Questions: What's a negative trait a current manager would say describes you?

title: Registered Nurse, BSN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center in Nov 2018
Interview Descriptions: The interview was simple with basic interview questions with one HR rep. I then went straight to the office to meet  with the manager and the doctor I would later work with.
Interview Questions: There were a lot of 'tell me time' questions.

title: Nurse Practitioner Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Hiring process was lengthy. HR questions were standardized type, felt as though I repeated myself a lot with them. Interview had good questions and discussion but felt like nothing I said was heard in the end. Declined the offer due to compensation. First offer was below current salary, second below current salary and third was matching. I have experience so this was not a new graduate negotiation. No compensation for additional work such as call, that was “built in”. Did offer RVU bonus but no one knew that was bonus structure looked like to give a good inclination as to what compensation would be. Declined due to the lack of compensation, what seemed to be distraction from the hiring process and disconnect between HR and the practice.
Interview Questions: What appeals to you about working for this facility?

title: Registered Nurse, Oncology Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Informal and provided opportunity for shadow experience. Recruiters contacted you with pre interview questions and provided  benefit information and compensation up front. Everyone was professional and provided positive feedback when needed or asked.
Interview Questions: How many unscheduled days off did you take in the last six months?

title: Practice Administrator Fellow Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Oct 2018
Interview Descriptions: Completed an application, then proceeded to do an on-demand interview where recorded answers to interview questions via their web service. After the on-demand interview I was selected for the first on-site interview and then a week later I was invited for the final on-onsite interview with the vice-presidents. I was also able to meet the other applicants and get a tour of the facility.
Interview Questions: Tell us about a challenging time in your life where you really had to work hard for something. What was the result and how has this affected you professionally?

title: Cytotechnician Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions:
The interview process was easy, got phone call and interviwed and got job offer within 15 days.
The interview process was easy, got phone call and interviwed and got job offer within 15 days.
Interview Questions: what do you notice in around atmosphere

title: Intern Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Jul 2018
Interview Descriptions: It was great, called me on the phone and ask me questions first and was helpful to relax first. They ask other questions about the jobs I had before like my time in the services. Ask about my roles and what are things I like about my jobs.
Interview Questions: Do I need benefits

title: RN, Bsn Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: It was simple easy. Nothing caught me off guard. I interviewed with someone in Human Resources. Afterward he sent me straight to the office I was interviewing for where I met with the office manager and the doctor I was interviewing to work with.
Interview Questions: What are your strengths and weaknesses

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Jul 2017
Interview Descriptions: Interview with HR for about ten minutes then the nurse manager of the floor applied for. They asked the basic generic questions. Tell me about yourself and what would you do if you were in certain situations.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Mar 2017
Interview Descriptions: The interviewers were great! I didn't feel intimidated at all. They were nice and to the point. They went over everything. I interviewed with the management of the registration management.
Interview Questions: Are you comfortable asking patients for payment?

title: Management Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Very professional, courteous recruiters, thorough interview process, many return interviews before offer was made approximately 4 to include upper level management, internal staff and peer interviews.  Process was somewhat lengthy to get offer and pay was lower than expected.
Interview Questions: Reason for seeking new opportunity? Desired Salary? Management Style?

title: Human Resources Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Sept 2016
Interview Descriptions: The hiring and interview process was very thorough. I knew when and where I was expected to go at all times. The interview process was direct and straight forward in trying to make sure I was a good match for company culture. I was interviewed by two individuals at the same time, which turned out not to be as intimidating as I initially thought. My interviewers were engaging making me feel at ease during the process instead of a bundle of nerves.
Interview Questions: What would you do if you were falling behind in your workload?

title: Patient Access Representative Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: I waited over 30 minutes after my "scheduled" appt before someone came to get me. Then it took a month to learn I didn't get the job, after two unanswered calls.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself?

title: Business Services Analyst Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: Interview process is about what you'd expect. Initially received a call from HR discussing my interest in the position and their interest in bringing me in for a one on one interview. The interview itself was a one part process, came in and met with the director and supervisor discussing job interest and duties upon hire. Process took a little long than I'd like, after the initial interview the waiting game went on for nearly a month.
Interview Questions: Explain how my prior employment required me to think analytically and how might I apply that in a healthcare environment.

title: Emergency Department Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: I applied and took them almost a month to call for interview. I first did a brief interview with human resources, then I was walked over to interview with the ED director. I was called back 30 minutes after I left the first interview to do a peer interview. There was 4 people who worked in the Emergency Department there to do the panel. I was then given an opportunity to complete a job shadow a couple of days later. After the job shadow, about 4 days later, they called back and offered me the position. Pretty laid back, yet professional interview. The job shadow was really fun and really helped me see exactly what my job would be like.
Interview Questions: How would you deal with the stress of working in the ED?

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Dec 2015
Interview Descriptions: The overall process took 4 weeks. I initially applied to several positions listed online, however, was not selected for any. The HR Recruiter called and saw that I was putting for effort to try and find a position with LMC, and sought out positions for me that she thought I would be a good fit for. I interviewed for a BOA and was offered the job within a few weeks. She was amazing. She is so caring and genuinely wants to help find you a position!
Interview Questions: How would you handle a difficult situation, what helps you organize

title: Nurse Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Nov 2015
Interview Descriptions: was great going through HR and they did their best to make a fit with your experience that I had and the best place to place me. After getting my qualifications I was set up with the department and had an interview with them
Interview Questions: why would you like to work for Lexington Medical Center

title: ERP ProgrammerIV Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Sept 2015
Interview Descriptions: 4 rounds of Interview. Had a phone screening followed by Panel Interview. Then I met with HR, Employment and senior Management in the following rounds. Interview was long and the total process took about 3 months however I was happy that I got to talk to my future teammmates and senior management before I could make my decision.
Interview Questions: My Technical Skills

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC)
Interview Descriptions: Applied for part time position and was called for an interview within 2 weeks. During interview, HR representative asked if I would be interested in a different position that she felt would be perfect for me. After describing the alternative position, I agreed that it sounded more suitable for me. She was very good at looking at the individual person and matching them with the right job. She was professional, but friendly and was really excited showing me the different opportunities available.
Interview Questions: What experience do you have? Are you able to work in a fast paced environment?

title: Nurse Tech Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Interviewed with recruiter and he asked me a few questions/went over benefits/pay/orientation. Then with the unit manager; asked questions and showed me around the floor. Manager then walked me out and said they would call. Received a call within a few days for an offer.
Interview Questions: Basic interview questions and some patient scenarios.

title: Respiratory Therapist Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: Rather well streamlined. Very little outsourcing. Personable manager. More of a chat than a hard core interview. Easier than most but I feel it was this way because it was a referral and not s cold call interview.
Interview Questions: Background information. Skill set. Knowledge of equipment and procedures,

title: Pediatric Cardiac Sonographer Interview
Application Type: I applied through a staffing agency. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Columbia, SC) in Dec 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a phone interview with the hiring manager. Our discussion was a collaborative conversation that discussed my work ethic and my level of experience. This was key to the department as they wanted me to understand my role and acclimate smoothly.  Because of my ability to be very flexible and accommodating  to the department, I was hired.  It was a wonderful experience to work with the technical and medical staff.
Interview Questions: What type of equipment I had experience using.

title: Administrative Assistant III Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions:
Interview process was first with HR individual, then with department position was in. However , I never got a call stating I wasn't being offered the position. I actually called Monday and left a message on HR representative that did initial interview and never got a call back. I checked the website on Monday and Tuesday to see if the application status changed which it had not, then on Wednesday I checked the website and that is how I found out I was not being offered the position.  

  I really felt if I was called in for an interview, I should have been called back after leaving a message regarding the status regardless if I was being offered the position or not.
Interview Questions: How would I approach my supervisor if something could not be done because of policy?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Jul 2014
Interview Descriptions: A long personality test is required. I applied online, and the application can be applied to multiple job offers in the hospital. They are looking for people with initiative and good attitudes, which is why I chose the hospital in the first place
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Business Office Associate Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: I had two interviews. One with the HR department and the second with my department manager. I had them back to back in the same day and was also notified of my job offer that day.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work at LMC?

title: Registered Nurse Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 6 weeks. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: long and drawn out.  took  months to complete interview process. interview with managers, directors, peers, supervisor and all other  staff members.   same questions over and over again, interviewed by some of the same people that were applying this same position.
Interview Questions: would handling conflict effect my opinion of the staff member

title: BOA Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: HR interviewed then office manager. Was hired on the spot. Orintation was a week later then training was another week. The process after excepting the job was long. There wasn't much to the interview. If the like you you are in pretty much.
Interview Questions: What I like to do on my off time

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (Lexington, SC) in Mar 2013
Interview Descriptions: Called for interview, scheduled interview met with panel was asked many performance based interview questions related to experience, skills, length of previous employment, future plans, career plans.  The manager made me feel very comfortable, a tour of the unit was provided. I was offered refreshments.
Interview Questions: What type of patients did I like to care for best

title: Envirmental Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center
Interview Descriptions: There was a total of 3 interviews. 1 with human resources, 1 with managment, and 1 with the supervisor.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Registration Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Mar 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was short and brief.  They asked a few questions about my background and what I can bring to the company.  They also asked where do I see myself in 10 years, and how flexible I am able to be with my schedule. There are a lot of call outs so being able to work weekends and extra shifts will benefit.
Interview Questions: Describe a time when you were challenged

title: Practice Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: HR contacted me and interviewed me.  Then I interviewed with the departmental director and met the team.  Pretty straightforward process though it was extended as I interviewed with a few different departments for similar positions.  Organized and kept me informed.  Everybody was really friendly.  Nice clean facilities at main campus and easy to find.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself.

title: BOA III Interview
Application Type: The process took 1+ week. I interviewed at Lexington Medical Center (West Columbia, SC) in Jun 2009
Interview Descriptions:
I applied for several positions, (4 to be exact)  at lexmed.com.  I was not called to interview for all the positions I applied for.  I was contacted about 2 of them however.  
At one of the two interviews I was told about a position that the recruiter thought was a better fit for my skills and certifications, but was not yet advertised.  I really appreciated that she put some time into looking at my qualifications and specific skills prior to my interview.  
The recruiter was very informative and knowledgeable about the position that I did apply for as well as the one she suggested would be a better fit.  She knew about the qualifications, specifics and salary for both positions as well as the benefits that LMC offers.
While I was waiting for my interview there were several LMC employees obviously waiting to talk to a recuiter about a matter and they were very friendly and positive about being employees of LMC which I appreciated.  The receptionist that I initially met as I walked through the door greeted me with a smile.  As I waited, I observed that she was very cordial to everyone that she came in contact with from fellow employees to someone asking directions to people like myself who were there for an interview.
My overall experience was a good one.  
My family and I are patients at several of the different physician practices and have been inpatients at the hospital and have had positive experiences every time.
Interview Questions: Why I thought I was a good fit for the position, and be specific.
